subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Digital Voice Recorder Advice
author: Debbie Tejada
full_text:
Well, I just had to laugh. This year for Christmas I bought my best  
friend's 12 yr old son an AM/FM radio kit from Edmund Scientific's web  
site. I offered to help him with soldering, since I did know that  
would be needed and I've done stained glass in the past. Well, I'm kid- 
sitting this weekend for him and his younger sister, and he brought  
the kit with him so we can get started. I didn't realize it was going  
to be about a million teensy pieces that need to be assembled and ALL  
soldered into place, with explanations of why things are done and why  
they work. Very intimidating!

Butâ€¦ I now realize that when I'm done with this project I will  
understand a whole lot more about radio waves and how they work. Yet  
another interesting coincidence? Hah!
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

Debbie Tejada


"Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing  
that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy. "  ~Albert  
Einstein

On Dec 29, 2007, at 11:07 AM, Ursula Bielski wrote:

>
> As far as I know, Mark has been focusing on lecturing with his  
> Luminator machine, and that is how he is bringing the ITC message to  
> the public.
> Mark says that not even Mark really knows how it works, but the  
> Luminator apparently recycles air through liquid-filled coils to  
> sort of change the molecular structure of the atoms--I think!:)   
> This gives discarnate entities just enough mass to be photographed.
> As a result, photographs taken of people in a room where the  
> luminator is running often show spirit faces superimposed over the  
> faces of the living subjects.  You can read more in Mark's book,  
> "Spirit Faces."
> I don't think Mark is a member of any experimental forums; but I  
> would say, invite him!  He just might join!
>
> Best,
> Urs
>
> Debbie Tejada <debbie@...> wrote:
> Wow, I'm loving all this information, it's giving me a lot of ideas.  
> Very exciting for me!
>
> Does Mark Macy belong to this forum too? I met him about 3 years  
> ago. My husband is a commercial photographer and Mark asked him to  
> do his portrait for a book he was coming out with. He came to our  
> home studio for the portrait, and I got to talk with him a little  
> about what he does. At that time all I knew of EVP was from the  
> White Noise movie, wasn't sure it was real. But Mark was very nice,  
> passionate about ITC/EVP and very convincing. I wasn't quite sure  
> what to expect when I originally heard what he did, with all the  
> loonies out there claiming all kinds of stuff, but I got a really  
> good feeling from him and he's very, well, like I said, convincing.  
> After that I went to his web site and also bought one of his books,  
> which was a nice read.
>
> I went to the Stanley Hotel in November with a ghost hunting group  
> and Mark was a speaker there. I was really looking forward to his  
> lecture, but ended up with a wicked stomach virus and had to come  
> home early. I missed just about everything that weekend!
>
> Deb T
>
>
>
> On Dec 29, 2007, at 9:51 AM, Ursula Bielski wrote:
>
>>
>> Oops! .  I forgot to answer: No, I have not given up ghost hunting  
>> at all, but over the years I have come to focus more on the  
>> collection and distribution of experiences than on encountering  
>> phenomena myself.  ITC has really affirmed this for me.
>> I've felt all along that my job is to make people aware that  
>> spiritual phenomena go on all the time in millions of lives; I'm  
>> not a scientist and I know nothing I do will change the way science  
>> thinks.  BUT if I can open the minds of young people today, perhaps  
>> our future scientists will make it their business to figure all  
>> this out.
>> I know this is a lot of what ITC experimenters are doing:  
>> convincing others of the afterlife by their recorded evidence.   
>> Amazing things can happen when THAT happens.
>> Again, Mark Macy is so wonderful because he has dedicated his life  
>> to this.  He and his colleagues have received such detailed  
>> descriptions of how the afterlife works, that they have helped the  
>> living change their lives to erase the fear of death--and to live  
>> in a way that brings us to as high a spiritual level as possible  
>> right away when our bodies die.  This means, for example, dealing  
>> with issues and addictions, that plague us in life, since the  
>> spirits tell us we take it all with us!  That is, death isn't a  
>> cure-all.
>> Any glimpse at the history of ITC shows us that all of this has  
>> been gradually growing since the 19th century, when state-of-the- 
>> art graphite pencils and telegraphs were used to contact the dead.   
>> Since then, there have been "breakthroughs" a number of times when  
>> astounding floods of messages have come through.
>> You experimenters are all so incredible--I'm amazed every day at  
>> your love, dedication and faith.  Surely something wonderful is  
>> going to come from all this, and I think it's going to come during  
>> our lifetimes.
>>
>> Ursula
>>
>>
>>
>> Robin Searcy Henson <MudPuddleFarm@msn.! com>< /i> wrote:
>> Hello Bill,
>>
>> Yes, I did steal that phrase from Ursula because I thought it  
>> described what I was doing as compared to what I would like to be  
>> doing!
>>
>> I like what you said about focus on the equipment helping to  
>> establish the psychic connection.  It makes so much sense.  This  
>> discussion has definitely shown me that mental tools and  
>> preparation are as important as physical ones.
>>
>> Thank you for your input.
>>
>> Robin
>>
>>
>> ----- Original Message -----
>> From: psi_research
>> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>> Sent: Friday, December 28, 2007 9:37 PM
>> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Digital Voice Recorder Advice
>>
>> oops. I see it was Ursula who posted the "r vs. r" statement. And
>> Ursula your post is so much more eloquent and you've articulated the
>> point much better than I could. I'll bow out of your way -Bill
>>
>> --- In EVP-ITC@...! m, " psi_research" <vilhellm@...>  
>> wrote:
>> >
>> > Hi Robin,
>> > Your phrase of "ritualized vs. random" is interesting. There are  
>> many
>> > who believe that communication is between the conscious of the
>> > researcher and the entity and the equipment is secondary. It's  
>> easy to
>> > get swept up in the technology and forget there is possibly a  
>> psychic
>> > connection going on. With that said, focusing on equipment actually
>> > can help the researcher become receptive to establishing a
>> > communication link. While paying attention to the equipment, we  
>> forget
>> > about the daily distractions and minor irritations that may  
>> prevent us
>> > from establishing contact.
>> >
>> > The setting up the gear we use could be considered the first part  
>> of
>> > the "ritual". I like to clear my mind, set up equipment, mess  
>> with it
>> > some more, then I am mentally prepare to begin what I hope will  
>> be a
>> > successful session.
>> >
>> > I guess "random" recording to me would be what happens in the field
>> > during a paranormal investigation. I don't bring Box technology  
>> into a
>> > location with the intention of possibly contacting lingering  
>> spirits
>> > at that location but I do bring audio recorders in hopes of  
>> recording
>> > evp's.
>> >
>> > I find the Box works perhaps even better when I'm in a familiar  
>> place
>> > like the room in my home that is designated for that purpose. I do
>> > desire to have the finest Box technology that is possible but more
>> > important is the association that seems to occur between the
>> > researcher and the Box that is favored. Despite some of the  
>> benefits
>> > of the new gear, the one that I seem to have a connection with is  
>> one
>> > that requires a little more finesse to operate. -Bill
>> &g! t;
>> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Robin Henson" <MudPuddleFarm@>  
>> wrote:
>> > >
>> > > Wow, thanks for your help guys!
>> > >
>> > > Ursula, your post was lovely. I've been promising myself to learn
>> > > more about Mark Macy's work and will check out his website ASAP.
>> > > Ritualized versus random recording makes sense to me now, as I  
>> want
>> > > to accomplish true communication rather than continue being  
>> verbally
>> > > abused. Have you given up "ghost hunting" altogether?
>> > >
>> > > I've been looking at the Olympus VN-4100 PC, Zack! I don't know  
>> if I
>> > > need that much recording time, but I sure have liked the one I  
>> have
>> > > and wouldn't mind upgrading a bit.
>> > >
>> > > Hi Frank! I basically follow your suggestion when recording,  
>> and once
>> > > I learned to be quiet I actually started getting responses. I  
>> think
>> > > the entities at my house got tired of playing with me though,  
>> and now
>> > > they aren't saying anything. I kind of miss them, but I do feel  
>> it's
>> &g! t; > time to move on.
>> > >
>> > > Robin
>> > >
>> > >
>> > >
>> > >

>> > > >
>> > > > Hi Robin,
>> > > >
>> > > > Radio Shack now carries the Olympus VN-4100PC at about the same
>> > > price I
>> > > > paid for my VN-960PC a couple years ago. I've been very happy  
>> with
>> > > the
>> > > > 960. The 4100 has about 4 times the recording time, I think.  
>> That
>> > > would
>> > > > make it about 24 hours.
>> > > >
>> > > > Zack
>> > > >
>> > > > On Sat, 29 Dec 2007, Robin Henson wrote:
>> > > >
>> > > > > Hi all,
>> > > > >
>> > > > > I'm new to the group but probably know some of you from  
>> another
>> > > > > list. I haven't been too active in the realm of EVP recording
>> > > > > recently, but have had what I consider excellent results in  
>> the
>> > > past
>> > > > > using my little refurbished Ebay-bargain Olympus VN-120 PC.
>> > > > >
>> > > > > I'm anxious to start recording again and am feeling pretty
>> > > > > overwhelmed by the technology you all seem to be using. I  
>> know a
>> > > > > little about using good headphones and denoiser programs, but
>> > > beyond
>> > > > > that I'm electronically challenged. Still, I wonder if  
>> there are
>> > > > > simple techniques I can experiment with to increase my  
>> success. I
>> > > > > think I'm a little bored.
>> > > > >
>> > > > > I've felt pretty strongly that I've been communicating with  
>> a very
>> > > > > small number of entities, and I'm wondering if that's due  
>> to the
>> > > > > limitations of my equipment. My most impressive EVPs have  
>> always
>> > > been
>> > > > > captured around my own home, particularly outside on the  
>> hill and
>> > > > > near the barn. I've gotten two inside my house (after  
>> inviting
>> > > > > spirits in), and probably 75% in total have been negative
>> > > messages.
>> > > > >
>> > > > > Anyway, I'm thinking about getting another DVR and would  
>> love to
>> > > hear
>> > > > > your thoughts and recommendations about which ones are  
>> best. I
>> > > would
>> > > > > like to communicate with more advanced entities eventually,  
>> but
>> > > > > unfortunately don't have the brain for building anything  
>> myself.
>> > > > >
>> > > > > Thanks!
>> > > > >
>> > > > > Robin
>> > > > >
